text: <@U06DFL7BP> starting to hone in on what's wrong with vroom pushes. Looks what's being used to run scheduled tasks on the vroom server is what's failing. There's a function that sends pushes using parse that is set to run each hour, and it's never being called. If I go in and run the function manually, the pushes get sent just fine.
So I'll spend some time trying to figure out what's wrong with Celery (our task queue). If it's super broken we can schedule the pushes a different way.
np! It's good news that parse isn't broken :simple_smile:
we were tracking down to see if they donâ€™t have a credit card :stuck_out_tongue:

On a sorta related note, I was curious how our postgres backups were doing, so I tried to log into the vroom production AWS account to check them out on S3, and it looks like the credentials we have for that account are out of date <@U06DFL7BP>
Maybe that's on purpose to keep us out? But it seems like a good idea for us to maintain access
